704522f.title: Brooklyn: Fulton Street - Bond Street
704522f.text:
Fulton Street, at the S.W. corner of Bond Street, showing am upright of
the Fulton Street Elevated line of the B.M.T. on Fulton Street. The corner
building was occupied in 1889, by Frederick Loeser and Co., s department
store, still doing business at this location in 1937; from 1869-1889, they
occupied the block bounded by Fulton, Washington,and Tillary Streets.
About 1900.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
VAY BE REPPODUCED.
704522f.folder: Fulton Street & Bond Street, Brooklyn, NY

703265f-a.title: Brooklyn: Bond Street - Fulton Street
703265f-a.text:
Bond Street, east side, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Fulton
Street. The view shows the home of Browning, King and Company,
men's furnishers.
April 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
703265f-a.folder: Bond Street & Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY

704520f.title: Brooklyn: Fulton Street - Bond Street
704520f.text:
Fulton St. adjoining n.e. corner Bond St., B'klyn.
May 13, 1942
P.L. Sperr, photographer
704520f.folder: Fulton Street & Bond Street, Brooklyn, NY
